mentions.context: Scaper operates by taking a set of foreground sounds and a set of background sounds and automatically sequencing them into random soundscapes sampled from a user-specified distribution controlling the number and type of sound events, their duration, signal-to-noise ratio, and several other key characteristics.
The metrics are computed using the sed eval library [18].

A subset of 754 soundscapes is generated with Scaper scripts are designed such that the distribution of sound events per class, the number of sound events per clip (depending on the class) and the sound event class co-occurrence are similar to that of the validation set which is composed of real recordings.

A subset of 754 soundscapes is generated with Scaper scripts are designed such that the distribution of sound events per class, the number of sound events per clip (depending on the class) and the sound event class co-occurrence are similar to that of the validation set which is composed of real recordings.
We generated strongly annotated synthetic soundscapes using the Scaper library [11].
Three variants of this subset are generated with the same sound event scripts and varying values of the background SNR parameter.
The synthetic soundscapes are annotated with strong labels that are automatically generated by Scaper [11].
The DESED synthetic soundscapes evaluation set is comprised of 10-second audio clips generated with Scaper [11], a Python library for soundscape synthesis and augmentation.
Six alternative versions of the subset fbsnr 30dB are generated introducing artificial degradation with the Audio Degradation Toolbox [13].
The DESED synthetic soundscapes evaluation set is comprised of 10-second audio clips generated with Scaper [11], a Python library for soundscape synthesis and augmentation.
